}} 'Johann Karl Wilhelm Illiger' (19 November 1775 â 10 May 1813) was a German
entomologist and zoologist.

Illiger was the son of a merchant in Brunswick. He studied under the
entomologist Johann Hellwig, and later worked on the zoological collections of
Johann Centurius Hoffmannsegg. Illiger was professor and director of the
zoological museum in Berlin from its formation in 1810 until his death.

Illiger was the author of Prodromus systematis mammalium et avium (1811), which
was an overhaul of the Linnean system. It was a major influence on the adoption
of the concept of the 'Family'. He also edited the Magazin fÃ¼r Insektenkunde
widely known as Illiger's Magazine.
